entry.title: The House hunger built
entry.summary:
Author: FearTheHime

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 62,226Chapters: 12/?Kudos: 436

Summary: "Of course I eat people, I mean...It's not something I would broadcast since it's...well Gotham and they began to make a phad about it because the citizens are brilliantly...stupid."Bodies are piling up, whatever is left. Families; different backgrounds, different ethnics, religions, looks are being eaten and whatever is left into a master piece. Some sort of art with the remains and everyone was losing time and leads to find out who has been feasting upon Gotham citizens. Jason however, knew of a Cannibal that he totally never mentioned to Bruce. It's not Jason's fault he died before revealing his darkest discovery and that discovery is in the form of a boy he had left behind. [M/N] [L/N]; Mortitan, brilliant, a chef of his own making and conisear of flesh.All Jason needed to do is sweeten the deal in a way that drives all people, after all at the end of the day {M/N] is human after all."Besides..it's people...they are literally born every day..so who cares if a few of them...just disapear once in a while?"

entry.title: delayed satisfaction is the sweetest
entry.summary:
Author: dreamtiming

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,132Chapters: 4/4Kudos: 162

Summary: “That’s why you keep asking to go on patrol with me, right? My cutting intellect?” He asks, dipping a fry from his takeout box in a pool of ketchup. You wonder if the splotch on his sleeve is from a rather exuberant dip, or if it’s blood from earlier. “Among other things.” You say, feeling like it’s finally your turn to offer someone an ambiguous response. Especially as he returns to this topic of conversation he is so insistent on having out with you. For emphasis, you take a great bite of your food to allot you more time to muster defenses. “What other things?” Jason presses, because it might work with someone else—but not him, who, with no protection of the mask to guide his face, bores his eyes into you. “Like the fact that you paid for the food.” You offer gleefully, both of you knowing this is unsatisfactory. “Can’t be the only thing.” He says, his tone surprisingly level. Why on earth is your heart beating so fast? tl;dr: stuck in the middle with you. Dick Grayson/Reader/Jason Todd

entry.title: Red Hood: The Lost Valentine
entry.summary:
Author: happycomingteatime

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,248Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 18

Summary: After deciding it was best to take revenge on both Batman and The Joker, Jason decides visiting another person from his past can't hurt- especially when said person is his high school boyfriend that he never got to say goodbye to. What better day to do that than Valentine's Day? or Jason decides to drop by the reader's apartment on Valentine's day, not-so-secretly hoping that what they had is still alive. To show himself that he doesn't have to live in isolation, doesn't have to deprive himself of the things he wants, and that maybe he's still capable of love.

entry.title: Threads of Red
entry.summary:
Author: ddottodd

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,526Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 11

Summary: She’s the girl Gotham calls the “smiling, always positive nurse.” He’s the brooding vigilante in red, moving through the city’s shadows.When disaster strikes their worlds collide, he rescues, she heals. She tends to the frightened and injured, he fights to keep them alive.Two very different kinds of heroism. Two very different kinds of people. And somewhere between smoke, sirens, and the chaos of Gotham, something unspoken begins to grow.Can the girl who gives hope to everyone she meets reach the boy who trusts no one?
